statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: 6 score in double figures as Alabama St. beats Grambling St.
article.headline: 6 score in double figures as Alabama St. beats Grambling St.
article.linkText: 6 score in double figures as Alabama St. beats Grambling St.
article.story: GRAMBLING, La. -- Wendell Lewis, DeMarcus Robinson and Jamel Waters scored 12 apiece to lead six Alabama State players in double figures and the Hornets beat Grambling State 78-46 Thursday night. Bobby Brown had 11 points for Alabama State (17-9, 13-4 Southwestern Athletic Conference) while Luther Page and Tony Armstrong each scored 10. Lewis made 5 of 5 field goals and 2 of 2 free throws and Waters had seven assists. Grambling State (2-25, 0-17), which has lost 20 in a row, trailed just 31-24 at halftime despite making only 9 of 32 (28.1 percent) field goals before the break. Alabama State caught fire in the second, however, shooting 65.5 percent (19-29) and outscoring the Tigers 44-25. Remond Brown led Grambling State with 11 points and Richard Freeman added 10 with nine rebounds. A'Torri Shine, the team's leading scoring (13.4 per game), scored a career-low three points on 0-for-9 shooting.
